Text.Value: Ohhh, that makes way more sense. Let me try again!

EditorData.NodeContext: excited, raises her hands as if to cast a spell.

Text.Value: Exaudi me, Myrkul! Resuscita fratrem meum. E morte ad me redige eo!

EditorData.NodeContext: Hands held out in front of her at start of line. Much more confident and quick this time around. Powerful.

Text.Value: My big brother, Garret. He got killed by that murderer guy - but I'm gonna fix him. Now, keep watch!

EditorData.NodeContext: holds her hands out in front of her, closes her eyes - read to cast

Text.Value: The Mortarch is teaching me lots about death - and how it isn't that scary. She's a lot nicer than I thought.

EditorData.NodeContext: a cautious smile, she's feeling much better

Text.Value: I'm coming Garret, just hang on.

EditorData.NodeContext: holds her hands out in front of her, closes her eyes - read to cast

Text.Value: Here - this scroll might do the trick.
Keep trying - you'll get it eventually.
Psst - keep a lookout. The Mortarch don't take kindly to raising the dead - but I won't be long, I promise.

EditorData.NodeContext: Furtive, knows if she gets caught she'll be in big trouble. She's standing in front of a large gravesite.

Text.Value: The spell you're looking for is 'Raise Undead'. This is how you do it...
Fine. I won't try again... for now, at least.

EditorData.NodeContext: knows player is right - a little unhappy about it though

Text.Value: I don't care what you say! I'm gonna save my brother!

EditorData.NodeContext: furious

Text.Value: That's dumb - I'm using magic, not a bow.

EditorData.NodeContext: rolling her eyes - another dumb grown up wasting her time

Text.Value: I ruined it - I ruined everything.

EditorData.NodeContext: sees her brother garret, a broken skeleton, just in front of her. Upset, horrified, and heartbroken.

Text.Value: Like... like this?

EditorData.NodeContext: raises her hands as if to cast a spell.

Text.Value: *The air crackles with power - before fizzing out. The child has power but lacks control.*
Your brother's soul is at rest - it is not fair to disturb it. Make peace with your dead, child.
I want you home, Garret - mam won't stop crying. And dad is always at the pub...

EditorData.NodeContext: doesn't even see player - staring at the grave in front of her

Text.Value: Whatever you're doing - stop it. Magic isn't a game.
Well it's this or cry - which isn't gonna help my big bro. Now, keep watch!

EditorData.NodeContext: holds her hands out in front of her, closes her eyes - read to cast

Text.Value: That was dangerous! You must never do that again.
Exaudi me, Myrkul! Resuscita fratrem meum. E morte ad me redige eo!

EditorData.NodeContext: hands held out in front of her, frowning with concentration - clearly struggling with the spell, maybe tripping up a word or two

Text.Value: You're just a child. Is this a good idea?
I'm busy. Go away.

EditorData.NodeContext: angry with player

Text.Value: The Mortarch said the same thing... but I miss him. A lot.

EditorData.NodeContext: sad, but also knows the player is right

Text.Value: *She nods along, enraptured by your explanation.*
Urgh - you're worse than the Mortarch. Whatever.

EditorData.NodeContext: rolling eyes

Text.Value: You need to focus your power - make it a sharpened point, like the tip of an arrow.
Oh, I'm not going anywhere - not until my brother is all right.

EditorData.NodeContext: nodding, eager - glad tohave the player encouraging her

Text.Value: I'll figure it out by myself - thanks.

EditorData.NodeContext: kinda surprised player is still standing there

Text.Value: Sure. The coast is clear.
No - he said we'd always have each other's backs. He promised! So butt. Out.

EditorData.NodeContext: furious

Text.Value: Who are you raising from the dead?
You're close, Myrkul - I can feel your shadow! Give my brother back, please.

EditorData.NodeContext: drops her hands, frustrated, angry and upset

Text.Value: *She blinks at your explanation, which involved hand gestures and five-syllable words.*
That sounds dumb. And wrong. I'll figure it out on my own, thanks.

EditorData.NodeContext: rolling her eyes - another dumb grown up wasting her time

Text.Value: Instruct the child in faerie rites of raising the dead.
Teach the child deep, forbidden magic to regurgitate a soul from the void.
Tell the child all you know of how fiends snatch souls from the afterlife.
Really? I'm gonna try it right now!

EditorData.NodeContext: generic taking motion. Delighted

Text.Value: You wish to raise the dead? Allow me to teach you, curious child...
Raising a fallen creature? Paltry magic. Allow me to explain...
Magic is about instinct. Trust you gut, trust your magic - and the rest will flow.
Hm. Maybe if I make the spell extra big. Uh, do you mind? I'm doing magic stuff.

EditorData.NodeContext: first line said to herself - she has no idea what she's doing but she's gonna do her best. Sees player, doesn't know why they're standing there like a weirdo

Text.Value: Your brother deserves to rest in peace - let him.

Synopsis: Nina is a little girl who loved her big brother dearly. He was murdered by Dolor - the serial killer. She has some magic, and is desperately trying to bring her big brother back to life.
